text: When faced with a difficult decision, what do you typically do?

options.text: Go with what feels right in my heart
Consider how I've handled similar situations before
Make a quick choice and stick with it
Analyze all the pros and cons carefully
Look for an unconventional solution

text: How do you react when plans suddenly change?

options.text: Feel anxious or upset about the disruption
Adapt quickly and find a way forward
Decide on a new course of action immediately
Assess the new situation thoroughly before acting
See it as an opportunity to try something different

text: When working on a project, you prefer to:

options.text: Work with people you have good chemistry with
Persist through challenges until completion
Set clear goals and milestones
Research and plan extensively before starting
Experiment with innovative approaches

text: In social situations, you're most likely to:

options.text: Sense and respond to others' emotions
Stay composed even in awkward moments
Take charge of organizing activities
Observe and analyze group dynamics
Come up with fun, original ideas

text: When learning something new, you:

options.text: Connect it to personal experiences
Keep practicing despite initial difficulties
Focus on practical applications quickly
Break it down into logical components
Try to modify or improve the method

text: Your approach to problem-solving is:

options.text: Considering how solutions will affect people emotionally
Trying multiple approaches until something works
Choosing and implementing a solution quickly
Systematically evaluating all possibilities
Thinking outside the box for unique solutions

text: When you experience failure, you:

options.text: Feel deeply disappointed but process it emotionally
Bounce back quickly and try again
Decide immediately how to move forward
Analyze what went wrong to learn from it
See it as inspiration to try a different approach

text: In your free time, you prefer activities that:

options.text: Allow emotional expression or connection
Challenge you to push your limits
Have clear rules and objectives
Stimulate your intellect or curiosity
Let you express your originality

text: When working in a team, your strength is:

options.text: Understanding team members' feelings
Persisting through challenges with the group
Making quick decisions when needed
Providing logical analysis of situations
Contributing innovative ideas

text: Your friends would describe you as:

options.text: Compassionate and empathetic
Strong and dependable in tough times
Direct and action-oriented
Thoughtful and detail-oriented
Imaginative and unconventional

text: When facing criticism, you:

options.text: Feel it deeply but try to understand the emotional context
Take it in stride and use it to improve
Quickly decide whether to accept or dismiss it
Analyze its validity objectively
Consider unconventional perspectives it might offer

text: Your ideal work environment would be:

options.text: Harmonious with strong personal connections
Challenging but supportive of perseverance
Structured with clear decision points
Intellectually stimulating with complex problems
Flexible allowing for creative expression

text: When meeting new people, you:

options.text: Quickly sense their emotional state
Remain comfortable even if it's awkward
Decide quickly if you want to know them better
Observe and analyze their behavior
Enjoy their unique perspectives

text: Your approach to personal goals is:

options.text: Driven by what feels meaningful
Persistent despite obstacles
Focused on clear, actionable steps
Based on careful planning and analysis
Open to unconventional paths

text: When presented with a new idea, you:

options.text: Consider how it makes you feel
Work to understand it thoroughly despite complexity
Quickly judge its usefulness
Analyze its logic and evidence
Think of ways to modify or combine it with other ideas

text: In a crisis, your first instinct is to:

options.text: Check on everyone's emotional state
Stay calm and handle the pressure
Take immediate action to address it
Assess the situation methodically
Come up with an innovative solution

Emphasize perseverance and coping

options.text: Relating information to personal experiences

Stick to your decisions despite sales pitches
Make quick purchasing decisions

Remain composed even when challenged

text: Your approach to rules is:

options.text: Considerate of their emotional impact on people

options.text: Considers how solutions will affect people emotionally

Remain calm and stick to your position
